meanings.definition: To squirt or spurt out in a thin stream.
meanings.sent1: The water quirted from the hose onto the flowers.
meanings.sent2: She quirted ketchup onto her fries.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy quirted toothpaste all over the bathroom mirror.
meanings.sent4: The volcano quirted lava into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The lemon quirted juice into his eye, making him wince.

meanings.definition: To strike or whip with a quirt.
meanings.sent1: He quirted the horse to make it move faster.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy quirted his lasso skillfully.
meanings.sent3: She playfully quirted her brother with a rubber band.
meanings.sent4: The wind quirted the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The chef quirted the cream onto the dessert with precision.
